comments.commentBody:
Actually, Debra @1, I think the reason the Repubs have an easier time passing things is because they always get a few Democratic votes. The Dems are not a lockstep organization, you know. That's the primary difference between them.

Maybe we'll get lucky and a few of these clowns will drop over shoveling snow - save us voting them out.

Augustine:
Would you please specify precisely how your "family is suffering because of his (Obama's) incompetence, arrogance, and lack of integrity". Without any factual information to back up your statement, it is nothing more than specious.
Guessing you may be unfamiliar with that word, it means "having a false look of truth or genuineness". (Merriam-Webster Online Dictionary. 2010)
My sympathies go to his family, friends, staff, and constituents.  He served his country faithfully and well.

Whose idea was it to open up a London style restaurant in NYC? Better yet, who thought a London style restaurant would work in NYC? I do not know, but can say that the Pierre hotel has to have the worst food and beverage people working there. Just because it worked in London, doesn't mean it will work in NYC. Did you see Le Caprice's wine list? In the same neighborhood as Le Caprice is Daniels, a two Michelin starred restaurant. To compete against that you are going to need more then 40 selections on your list. Le Caprice should be open 24hrs a day, it might be better if it demoted itself to being a diner. I would go there after a night out on the town for some eggs and bangers. After-all, the English in my opinion, can make a really good breakfast. The Pierre should stick to what it does best and that is banquets.

The Tea Party movement continues to eat its young. And Sarah Palin has done it again: made herself a national joke. The foreign policy expert who can "see Russia from Alaska", the fahionista who "took the Nieman-Marcus clothes and ran", the compulsive winker, the "Can I call you Joe" genius who coudn't remember Biden's last name, has got America looking into its hand whenever we're at a loss for words.
Way to go!

"You've heard of the Bridge to Nowhere. You might call this the Airport for Nobody. The John Murtha Johnstown-Cambria County Airport has an impressive $18 million runway made of reinforced concrete that's big enough to land any airplane in North America. The airport also has a $7 million air traffic control tower, a $14 million hanger and $8 million radar. Most of the time, the only thing the airport doesn't have is airplanes.

An average of just 20 people a day flew out of the Murtha Airport last year. But, the airport was just awarded more federal money -- $800,000 in stimulus funds to repave an alternate runway.

Located in Johnston, Pa., 56 miles from Pittsburgh, the Murtha Airport is a monument to the power of Rep. John Murtha, D-Pa., who has steered some $150 million in taxpayer dollars to the airport over the last decade."

http://abcnews.go.com...

That's criminal theft, plain and simple.

Consider a short trip to the Sunshine Coast - 40 minute ferry through stunning scenery. Cedar decks, hot tubs, cozy, luxurious, something for everyone from 120+ bed & breakfast and cottage accommodations. www.bbsunshinecoast.com
Frances Wasserlein

Regarding your comments, Augustine 25: Aren't you disingenuously dodging the topic at hand? The story and the comments here relate to a Republican congressman who has unwisely blockaded your president's appointments (you are a patriot, right?), including several for leadership in departments of your military and your defense organizations, on which your country's safety depend. Once it came out that this congressman was doing this not for the general good of your country, but for contracts that benefit corporations in his state (i.e., corporations who finance his campaigns), he backtracked to avoid embarrassment and further damage to his party's reputation as the do-nothing, know-nothing earmarketeers.

Beyond this, has anyone noticed the increase of boilerplate, Karl-Rove-generated comments like Augustine's in the so called MSLM? No matter what the topic, just simplify and repeat. Less taxes, small government, more freedom. Never mind what's best or optimum. The dark art of propaganda is getting a grip on the throat of rational public policy discourse.

To counter, here are a few talking points of my own: As I see it, it's not about big government vs. freedom. It's about working towards BETTER government. The best possible government. If your streets aren't being paved or planes are crashing, you might want more government. If you're losing freedom or paying to much in tax, for no good reason and you might want less. Bad government is bad. But good government is good. But less is not always more! Reagan had it wrong.

In reply to those who say his body is not cold enough for others to get on his case. In his case, rumors were circulating for years, about the pork he got and the airport he built. What a waste of tax payers hard earned money. For shame.
He voted for the Iraq war in 2002-2003 and came out against it in 2005. Hello senator John Kerry, you had a true friend, voting for it & then voting against.
Nice touch!
Nancy Pelosi is going to miss him. I guess so will others, and in a strange way, so will I, but not for his devious ways of late, but rather for what he was in his earlier life.
Rest in peace congressman. Your war is over.

Cheating - instead of studying and being prepared for the tests of life - is wrong!
We should be concerned about the bad message that Palin conveys to kids. Let's make this lady's faux pax a teaching moment. Please remind your kid that cheating from a crib sheet on your hand is wrong! It will likely lead to other ethical violations and negative consequences. Palin's neglect and exploitation for political gain and/or profit of her children has resulted in well-publicized teen pregnancies, addiction to drugs and alcohol, and wild partying. Now this "lady" is sending another message to our kids - don't study - just cheat like I do!

Shooter,

It's ok for both of them to be scripted. The problem is that Palin is the one harping about it all the time. How can she bash the President for using a teleprompter and then 15 minutes late have to refer to her hand for talking points. Are you really having a hard time understanding the irony there.
What August 25 calls "government under 100% Democrat party rule" neglects a little thing called the Supreme Court.

Its great to see that mother nature can still have such influence over key legislature in america. If only the american citizens had such an effect, maybe this country would be a great democracy after all.

It seems like congressional democrats need to watch their backs. Not to seem insensitive but they havnt been able to stay in power lately. November 2010 may just see a huge turn in the tides and see the government go conservative again. God Bless America!

Love how them conservative blogs are exploding. Excuses, excuses. The empress has no cheap clothes. She spent so much money on her hair that she could not afford a teleprompter. But if she knows the questions beforehand as it appeared, why can't she memorize those answers? John McCain and Rick Warren. McCain knew what to say. Oh wait. McCain cheated too.

I wish though, that Sarah had told Scott Brown to write on his palm the correct number of jobs created by the stimulus...so he wouldn't come off as dim as she does. Or that maybe he would tell us why the association of Debt Collectors wants him to vote against any health care bill. That reason? Because chasing medical bankruptcies are a big part of their business.

Do the Tea Party Patriots know who's behind Freedom Works? Do they know who pays for those free bus rides to D.C.? (And they will not be fooled again!?) I'm going to need jaw surgery if I keep reading stuff like this.
Pigs at the trough, all the time lying about how they are all for "conservative government."

Not a single journalist has the courage to talk about Obama's gaffes over the weekend when he "read" the word "Corps men" three times in the same speech. It's pathetic and clarifying to see the irrational hatred toward Sarah Palin from the left and the MSM.
It is SO obvious to most Americans, There is never a critical article on Pelosi and Reid yet they are the ones in power screwing everything up.
But instead the media and the comment-haters dogpile on one woman. One woman. Crazy isn't it?

Some of the best business speakers I have known in 50 years on Wall Street, had some notes, many on the palm of their hand just to keep them on track and as a reminder not to continue on without  speaking to something that they thought was important.                        Obama has a teleprompter and I hear NONE of the lefts pundits criticize him for that.     And all the talking heads on MSNBC  could not stay on the air for 5 minutes without that rolling teleprompter that runs above the camera lens.    What a bunch of hypocrites...   YOU created Palin and now you have to live with the monster you created... Ditto the Tea Party members .. If you Keith, David, Chris, Rachel et al had not attacked them night in and night out they would not be who they are today...I just checked the daily ratings  and Fox is killing MSNBC.   who are losing viewers at the same rate that FOX is gaining them.....  You are losing....Obama is trapped.. No jobs, Iran making a fool out of him.. they have him on a string and are laughing their butts off.  China is angry too. North Korea is not falling in Line.. Two wars, Gitmo, higher taxes, bigger deficits..  The charm offense had worn off here in the USA  and is slowing down to a crawl across the world.. So much for the charm offensive..

You all play right into our hands by believing the MSM lies about the Tea Party. After November will you believe the spin as they try to explain the democrat bloodbath?
--------

Well, if Sarah is your leader and this really does happen then America is truely the land of the dumb and I for one will weep for our country and the fear of what it could become in the hands of a untied GOP and Teaparty. That will surely be a horrible thing to even think about. God help the world if it happens. A war in Iran is in your future. No Medicare or Social Security (GOP plan wants to tie to to market again). So if that happens those who voted will once again have the GOP/Tea Party fool them into thinking they are doing something for the Middle Class. What they will do this time is kill us once and for all.

Auggie

You gotta be a sham - NOBODY talks like that!
Francine, brilliant! lol

"I can always shop around and get another insurance company..."

Not if you have cancer. Or Lupus, Or COPD, heart failure, kidney disease, diabetes...
You'll get a big fat NO. Or you'll pay through your rotting nose.

You really are a piece of work. Again, as others have asked, and as I have asked in this forum re: Tea Party people; What freedoms have you lost since Obama was elected? Because that's the basic catch phrase: "We're sick of him taking away our freedoms!". What freedoms do you anticipate losing?

Go ahead, start with the socialism/Marxist garbage. It makes you look like a MORON.

All you people do is spout hyperbolic misinformation.

Christ on his cross, if this man had some nefarious agenda to enslave you all to re-education camps, don't you think he would've done it? The fool wont even call his own party to task.

What freedom has he taken from you? TELL US.

Usual Russophobic kicks aside, what did this NYT article told us about Ukraine and its people? - Not much. Andriy, even in his rather broken English, delivered us more on the country: that the country is closely divided in two halves, that the western Ukrainians treat their eastern compatriots with much distaste and I am sure the feeling is mutual. Also, that many of the developing country nationalists-"democrats" like play on our pathological fear of Russia, and manage to milk us for quite a few bucks which, if we hadn't been so stupid, we would keep for ourselves. Being played by Georgian,Polish, Baltic, Ukrainian and other nationalists in the vicinity of Russia only made us continue looking at Russia through the Cold War tank goggles. Hence, we continue to waste our money when Detroit looks like it had a war for a decade...

It's time to get over it. Soviets, including Ukrainians, lost the Cold War but we're still loosing it to none other than our military-industial-politico-corporate complex. The complex plays with our childish notions of military might and world pre-eminence. But we can't ever be the winners when we spend about a trillion dollars a year on this madness! Enough!

Finally, having lived in Canadian Quebec and having been to similarly divided Belgium and Italy, I foresee political instability for Ukraine for decades to come, since the Western Ukrainians won't melt into the Eastern Ukrainians and vice versa for very l;ong time. Which side should we be on? - Morally, on the side of honesty and civility. The rest is their business.

My 2 cents.

Want to guarantee nuclear proliferation? Continue to invade, occupy, sanction and subvert other nations, talk aggressively about "all options are on the table," and generally spit venom at any country that dares to act as if it is a sovereign state.

The only way to put the nuclear genie back in the bottle is comprehensive nuclear disarmament, across the board and for everyone. Otherwise, as long as this de facto nuclear apartheid continues, so will nuclear proliferation.

It defies logic to say that the same thing in the US arsenal is legitimate, but in the arsenal of another nation it is not... where with semantic alchemy it is suddenly transformed into a "weapon of mass destruction."

Far from being irrational, and after the most recent example of Iraq, acquiring a nuclear weapon is the rational thing for a country that wants to guarantee its sovereignty to do. The reason is simple: a nuclear strike can impose a ghastly and unacceptable cost upon the larger power.

At that point, terms like victory and defeat after nuclear war become the words of only a Dr. Strangelove.

Siddhartha Banerjee
Oxford, Pa
